comments.text: If you are going to take a ship from Baku to Turkmenistan or to Kazakhstan, you can go to the port early and try to talk to one of the Turkish, Georgian or Azeri truck drivers. They can show you as a driver on paper and you can save 100$.

Cross the border on foot and walk for a few minutes to avoid the area where taxis wait. Here is a nice road going towards Baku. If you are lucky, you may find a direct ride. Try to explain beforehand that you are hitchhiking and not going to pay for the ride.
after the cross enough space to hitch. to askeran or van.
It's the bus 114 and it's a very bad spot if you want to go to Georgia, very few people use this road to go to Georgia nowadays, M2 highway is the best option.
very good spot
its the bsu 151 tht brings you there
dir: Shamakhi, Georgia. take the metro till 20 yanvar. there is a bus from that place till this point (ask people for the bus to Atyali).
Almost no traffic, but the second car picked me up.
The border crossing between Armenia and Karabakh. Cars have to stop for passport control so they drive slowly and will take you if they have space
Not enough cars. If you will stop someone - BE CAREFUL!!!! There are a lot of dangerous people in this area!
Simple spot on roadside. Towards Baku there's not much but enough traffic here. Be prepared to wait a little.
Long walk (45 minutes) to get here from the city center, but good spot at the edge of town. Expect many shorter rides.
It's along walk (45 minutes) out of the city center too get to the edge of town. Direct lift to Seki within 20 minutes though.
from Sheki to Zaqatala or to the Georgian border take the old (but recently renovated) road. you can hitch right after the rondabout, before the bridge.
The main road from Stepanakert to Armenia starts here. A policecar might stand here to check the speed of the cars passing, but this won't stop them from stopping
Very good spot to go to Ganja and Astara.
way to armenia. roads from shusha and stepanakert are joining here.

here is position to h-hike to Novosibirsk or Kemerovo directions.

siberian_explorer

Don't go there, because it's border only for trucks. Police officers will send you to another border (10 km, Astara). I tried get in Iran from Azerbaijan.

I was lucky here, local truck driver give me a ride 5 kilometres

Can be a good place to get a ride to Gandja and even Baku, many trucks going to those cities pass through this road, I had to wait for 2 hours to get a ride to Baku. expect lot of taxis, ask if it's free before getting in the car.
Visiting this village is really dangerous for your LIFE!!! Espesially if you are woman!
No cars, people looks like animals. After visiting this place we became to hate Azerbaijanians.
DONT GO THERE!!!!!! Local people are really unfriendly and wild!

Not much traffic (cars) in the direction of Laza. A couple of kilometers before Laza there's a big construction side (2012), so some trucks shuttle between Qusar and there. To get out of Qusar it's a long and sweaty walk (45 minutes).
Little traffic, so simply start walking. The first car or truck will stop for you.
Little traffic to Lahic, but possible. Be prepared to wait.

90% of cars are Taxi's or people wanting money. Roads are very twisty and mountainous, not great for trucks. Expect to hear taxi's shouting "Yeravan? Yeravan?" everywhere. Even when walking across the Iran Border!
Can sometimes be long waits (30-60 mins) due to little traffic.

Yeni Ceyranbatan (New Ceyranbatan)- reasonable spot to HH north (ex. Quba). Go to 20th January metro station and ask locals for buses to this village, it is on the road to Sumgait. It costs aproximately 50 kapik (2015). About 100m before junction with express road there is not very bad place to stop cars. No point walking and looking for bus stop. Waiting time very good but what decreases "hitchability" is not perfect place to stop cars.
